cards.name: Bellsprout
cards.text: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

cards.name: Weepinbell
cards.text: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.

attacks.name: Muddy Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Victreebel
cards.text: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Petilil
cards.text: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Lilligant
cards.text: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Phantump
cards.text: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Trevenant
cards.text: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 30 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Wimpod
cards.text: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.

attacks.name: Scamper Away
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

cards.name: Golisopod

abilities.name: Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.

attacks.name: Resolute Claws
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all results of those coin flips and begin flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

cards.text: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

cards.name: Litwick
cards.text: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Lampent
cards.text: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

cards.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon to another Pokémon.

cards.text: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Oricorio
cards.text: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.

attacks.name: Passionate Dance
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Salandit
cards.text: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Salazzle

abilities.name: Hot Poison
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned and Poisoned.

cards.text: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Turtonator
cards.text: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Turtonator-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shell Trap
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nitro Tank-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Alolan Sandshrew
cards.text: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Alolan Sandshrew
cards.text: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Alolan Sandslash

abilities.name: Slush Rush
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

cards.text: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Alolan Vulpix
cards.text: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

attacks.name: Beacon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Alolan Vulpix
cards.text: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

attacks.name: Beacon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Edge
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Path-GX
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from this Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Tentacool
cards.text: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.

attacks.name: Sludge Shock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Tentacruel
cards.text: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Seething Tentacles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Politoed
cards.text: They gather on moonlit nights to form a large chorus. Their cries sound angry and not at all pleasant, but they are certainly distinctive.

attacks.name: Roll Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Poliwag, a Poliwhirl, and a Poliwrath, and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hyper Jump
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

cards.name: Delibird
cards.text: Although it naturally prefers colder locales, Delibird in Alola seem able to withstand the heat to a certain extent.

attacks.name: All the Presents
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Carvanha
cards.text: Each school has its own territory. Any intruders are mercilessly attacked with fangs bared.

cards.name: Sharpedo
cards.text: It pursues its prey at speeds of 75 mph and finishes them off with fangs that can crush iron. It is known as the bully of the sea.

cards.name: Wailmer
cards.text: It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with seawater and plays by bouncing around like a ball.

cards.name: Wailord
cards.text: Wailord pursue their prey in pods. With their large mouths, they can swallow entire schools of Wishiwashi whole.

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Open Sea
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Water Pokémon.

cards.name: Snorunt
cards.text: Their numbers seem to have rapidly increased in Alola. Custom has it that houses where Snorunt live will be prosperous for generations to come.

cards.name: Glalie
cards.text: Legend says a boulder on an icy mountain absorbed the distress and regrets of a stranded mountaineer, giving rise to Glalie.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Floe
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Vanillite
cards.text: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Vanillish
cards.text: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Vanilluxe
cards.text: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frozen Breath
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Alomomola
cards.text: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.

attacks.name: Borne Ashore
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from either player's discard pile onto its owner's Bench.

cards.name: Wishiwashi

abilities.name: Schooling
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch this Pokémon with a Wishiwashi-GX in your hand. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.

cards.text: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Wishiwashi-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Torrential Vortex
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Surge-GX
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Mareanie
cards.text: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

attacks.name: Bail Out
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Alolan Geodude
cards.text: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.

attacks.name: Rock Polish
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Alolan Graveler
cards.text: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of part of its body.

attacks.name: Thunder Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Alolan Golem
cards.text: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Rock Wrecker
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Helioptile
cards.text: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Heliolisk
cards.text: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Vikavolt-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Zap Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigatron-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Oricorio
cards.text: This Oricorio has sipped bright yellow nectar. Its bright, cheerful dance melts the hearts of its enemies.

attacks.name: Feather Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Pom-Pom Punch attack's base damage is 100.

cards.name: Tapu Koko-GX

abilities.name: Aero Trail
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tapu Thunder-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn't really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn't particularly bothered.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Slowbro
cards.text: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellder's poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Facade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Burned or Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.text: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Garbodor
cards.text: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you'll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.

attacks.name: Trashalanche
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Item card in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Garbodor
cards.text: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you'll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.

attacks.name: Trashalanche
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Item card in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

attacks.name: Blown Kiss
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Gothorita
cards.text: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Gothitelle
cards.text: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

attacks.name: Tractorbeam
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Oricorio

abilities.name: Vital Dance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: This Oricorio relaxes by swaying gently. This increases its psychic energy, which it then fires at its enemies.

cards.name: Oricorio
cards.text: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Its elegant, attractive dance will send the minds and hearts of its enemies to another world.

attacks.name: Supernatural Dance
attacks.text: For each Pokémon in your opponent's discard pile, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Revelation Dance
attacks.text: If there is no Stadium card in play, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Toxapex-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Super Intense Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Total Shelter-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Mimikyu
cards.text: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by horror and died of the shock.

attacks.name: Filch
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Copycat
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon used an attack that isn't a GX attack during their last turn, use it as this attack.

cards.name: Dhelmise

abilities.name: Steelworker
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.

attacks.name: Anchor Shot
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Tapu Lele-GX

abilities.name: Wonder Tag
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Drive
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Tapu Cure-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Tapu Lele-GX

abilities.name: Wonder Tag
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Drive
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Tapu Cure-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Lunala
cards.text: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.

attacks.name: Shatter Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wings of the Moone
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.

cards.name: Machoke

abilities.name: Daunting Pose
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks. Your opponent's attacks and Abilities can't put damage counters on your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Machamp
cards.text: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.

attacks.name: Settle the Score
attacks.text: This attack does 80 more damage for each Prize card your opponent took on their last turn.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Sudowoodo

abilities.name: Roadblock
abilities.text: Your opponent can't have more than 4 Benched Pokémon. If they have 5 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 4 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

cards.text: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.

cards.name: Gligar
cards.text: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

attacks.name: Double Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Gliscor
cards.text: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

attacks.name: Finishing Stinger
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Nosepass
cards.text: The magnet in Nosepass's nose provides an unerring compass, making it an excellent partner for Trainers going on a journey.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Barboach
cards.text: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.

cards.name: Whiscash
cards.text: A glutton that devours anything that moves, it quietly lurks at the bottom of swamps, lying in wait for prey.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Landslip
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. This attack does 100 damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Pancham
cards.text: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Rockruff
cards.text: It's considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lycanroc-GX

abilities.name: Bloodthirsty Eyes
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dangerous Rogue-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Mudbray
cards.text: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Mudsdale
cards.text: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.

attacks.name: Enhanced Stomp
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: High Horsepower
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Minior
cards.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cosmicsplosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.name: Murkrow
cards.text: They awaken at dusk and take wing in the twilight, leading to the expression, "Get home before the Murkrow fly."

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Honchkrow
cards.text: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raven's Claw
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Sableye
cards.text: It's a fiend for gemstones, so it stalks Carbink. Unfortunately, Gabite almost always grabs them first.

attacks.name: Limitation
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

cards.name: Absol
cards.text: Long ago, superstitions were spread about it, saying it brought disaster. This fed a hatred of it, and it was driven deep into the mountains.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Doom News
attacks.text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

cards.name: Pangoro
cards.text: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro's Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Beldum
cards.text: Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism to communicate with others of its kind.

attacks.name: Core Beam
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Metang
cards.text: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.

attacks.name: Core Beam
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Metagross-GX

abilities.name: Geotech System
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic or Metal Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer during your next turn.

attacks.name: Algorithm-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Probopass
cards.text: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Solgaleo
cards.text: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.

attacks.name: Shining Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fangs of the Sunne
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Fangs of the Sunne during your next turn.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.

attacks.name: Follow Me
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: They don't like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Meteor Mash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Meteor Mash attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Cottonee
cards.text: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Whimsicott
cards.text: It rides on the wind and slips into people's homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.

attacks.name: The Wages of Fluff
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out during your next turn, take 2 more Prize cards.

cards.name: Sylveon-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magical Ribbon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Plea-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into your opponent's hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Sylveon-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magical Ribbon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Plea-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into your opponent's hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Comfey

abilities.name: Flower Shield
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it can't be affected by any Special Conditions. Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.

cards.text: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent draws a card.

cards.name: Goomy
cards.text: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it's unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If head, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Sliggoo
cards.text: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.

attacks.name: Division
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Sliggoo and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Goodra
cards.text: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.

attacks.name: Power Whip
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Beat Slider
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Drampa
cards.text: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it will completely destroy its surroundings with its intense breath.

attacks.name: Amass
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Jangmo-o

abilities.name: Bulletproof
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.

cards.name: Hakamo-o
cards.text: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.

cards.name: Kommo-o-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ultra Uppercut-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bind Wound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Blissey

abilities.name: Fresh Egg
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal 80 damage from your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Even the most ferocious Pokémon become calm when they eat Blissey's egg, which is said to be filled with happiness.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Taillow
cards.text: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Swellow
cards.text: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swallow Dive
attacks.text: If this Pokémon used Agility during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Castform
cards.text: It changes its form depending on the weather. Changes in the temperature or humidity appear to affect its cellular structure.

attacks.name: Weather Teller
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Stadium cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Rayquaza
cards.text: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

attacks.name: Turbo Storm
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

attacks.name: Glance
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Watchog
cards.text: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

attacks.name: Scrutinize
attacks.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck, discard 1 of them, and put the other card back.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Fletchling
cards.text: This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Fletchinder
cards.text: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Talonflame
cards.text: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Loop-the-Loop
attacks.text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

cards.name: Stufful
cards.text: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

cards.name: Bewear

abilities.name: Rake It In
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

cards.text: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

attacks.name: Dangerous Blow
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Komala

abilities.name: Comatose
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy from your hand to it, it is now Asleep.

cards.text: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.

attacks.name: Hypno Roll
attacks.text: This attack can be used if this Pokémon is Asleep. If it is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Drampa-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Righteous Edge
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Berserk
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Big Wheel-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Aether Paradise Conservation Area
cards.text: Basic Grass and Basic Lightning Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take 30 less damage from the opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Altar of the Moone
cards.text: The Retreat Cost of each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) that has any Psychic or Darkness Energy attached to it is ColorlessColorless less.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Altar of the Sunne
cards.text: Fire Pokémon and Metal Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) have no Weakness.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Aqua Patch
cards.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Brooklet Hill
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for a Basic Water Pokémon or Basic Fighting Pokémon and, put it onto their Bench, and shuffle their deck.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Choice Band
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon-GX or Active Pokémon-EX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Choice Band
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon-GX or Active Pokémon-EX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Loto
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Energy card you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Recycler
cards.text: Shuffle 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Enhanced Hammer
cards.text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Enhanced Hammer
cards.text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Field Blower
cards.text: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Field Blower
cards.text: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Hala
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. If you have used your GX attack, draw 7 cards. If not, draw 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mallow
cards.text: Search your deck for 2 cards, shuffle your deck, and put those cards on top of your deck in any order.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Max Potion
cards.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy from that Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Max Potion
cards.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy from that Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Multi Switch
cards.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Rescue Stretcher
cards.text: Choose 1: • Put a Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand. • Shuffle 3 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Rescue Stretcher
cards.text: Choose 1: • Put a Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand. • Shuffle 3 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Aero Trail
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Total Shelter-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Wonder Tag
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Intense Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Total Shelter-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Tapu Lele-GX

abilities.name: Wonder Tag
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Drive
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Tapu Cure-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Lycanroc-GX

abilities.name: Bloodthirsty Eyes
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dangerous Rogue-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Metagross-GX

abilities.name: Geotech System
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic or Metal Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer during your next turn.

attacks.name: Algorithm-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Metagross-GX

abilities.name: Geotech System
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic or Metal Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer during your next turn.

attacks.name: Algorithm-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Sylveon-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magical Ribbon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Plea-GX
attacks.text: Put 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into your opponent's hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Kommo-o-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ultra Uppercut-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Drampa-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Righteous Edge
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Berserk
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Big Wheel-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Aqua Patch
cards.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Enhanced Hammer
cards.text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Field Blower
cards.text: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Max Potion
cards.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy from that Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Rare Candy
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.text: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.
